senses.de: A set of pieces of creative work collected to be shown to potential employers or clients.
senses.ex: He presented a portfolio of his artwork to the gallery.

Tips.title: Showcase Abilities
Tips.description: Use 'portfolio' to present your skills and accomplishments in arts, design, or other creative fields.
Tips.example: I update my portfolio regularly with my latest graphic designs.

Tips.title: Not Always Physical
Tips.description: A portfolio can be digital, like a website, not just a physical binder or folder of work.
Tips.example: Check out my online portfolio to see all my photography work.

Tips.title: Beyond Art
Tips.description: Although common in creative fields, 'portfolio' can refer to any collection of work samples.
Tips.example: My coding portfolio includes samples of apps I've developed.

senses.de: The total amount of investments held by an individual or institution.
senses.ex: She manages an investment portfolio of around $1 million.

Tips.title: Investment Variety
Tips.description: In finance, a 'portfolio' usually includes a mix of stocks, bonds, and other assets to spread risk.
Tips.example: Her portfolio has a good balance of tech and healthcare stocks.

Tips.title: Not Just Stocks
Tips.description: 'Portfolio' can include non-traditional investments like real estate or art, not only financial securities.
Tips.example: He added several rare coins to his investment portfolio.

Tips.title: Risk Perspective
Tips.description: Investors often talk about 'portfolio' when discussing risk management and investment strategies.
Tips.example: We need to diversify the portfolio to reduce our exposure to market volatility.

senses.de: The role or duty of a Cabinet Minister or Secretary of State.
senses.ex: He was given the portfolio of Minister of Environment.

Tips.title: Government Roles
Tips.description: Use 'portfolio' to refer to the specific responsibilities or areas a government official manages.
Tips.example: She held the portfolio for foreign affairs.

Tips.title: Not a Document
Tips.description: In politics, 'portfolio' doesn't mean a physical folder but a range of duties or responsibilities.
Tips.example: After the election, he was assigned a new portfolio in the cabinet.

Anthology.wordDefinition:
An anthology is a collection of literary works, such as poems or short stories, by different authors.

It is usually compiled by an editor and published in a book form. An anthology can be used to showcase the works of several writers on a particular theme or genre.

An anthology is a collection of works by different authors, while a portfolio is a collection of an individual's best work.

Anthologies are commonly used in literature, while portfolios are commonly used in visual arts and design.

Catalogue.wordDefinition:
A catalogue is a list or collection of items, goods or products usually presented in a systematic order.

A catalogue is used by businesses to showcase their products while a portfolio is used by individuals to showcase their work or accomplishments.

Collection.wordDefinition:
A collection refers to a group of items that are gathered together based on some criteria, such as items of the same type or objects with a similar theme.

This could refer to anything from a collection of stamps to a collection of vintage cars.

A portfolio typically refers to a collection of work samples or projects that showcase a person's skills or accomplishments.

A collection is a group of objects, while a portfolio is a collection of work samples. Each term is applicable in different contexts, such as collecting items as a hobby or putting together a portfolio for a job or school application.

Compilation.wordDefinition:
A compilation is a collection of things, like songs or videos, that have been gathered together in one place.

A compilation is a collection of various works that is put together by someone else, while a portfolio is a selection of an individual's best work that they created themselves.

File.wordDefinition:
A file is a collection of documents or data that are related to each other and stored together. For example, a file can contain a series of documents related to a single project or a single topic.

Files are applicable in situations where a collection of related documents or data need to be organized and stored together.

Folio.wordDefinition:
A folio is typically a collection of papers or documents.

A portfolio usually refers to a collection of works or projects that showcase a person’s skills or talents.

For example, an artist may have a portfolio of their best paintings, drawings, and sculptures to show a potential employer.

A writer may have a folio of their research and notes for a book they are working on.

A folio is more general and can refer to any type of collection of papers or documents, while a portfolio is specifically a collection of works or projects to showcase one’s abilities.

Inventory.wordDefinition:
Inventory refers to a list of goods or items that a company has in stock or is available for sale. It is commonly used in the context of retail or manufacturing businesses.

In simpler terms, inventory relates to physical goods, while portfolio relates to financial assets. Inventory is applicable to businesses that sell tangible products, while portfolio is applicable to individuals or investors who manage their finances.

Register.wordDefinition:
A register is a list or record of items or events.

It may be used to keep track of inventory, attendance, or financial transactions. For example, a teacher may keep a register of student attendance or a business may keep a register of sales.

A portfolio is used to showcase one's skills and achievements, while a register is used to keep track of items or events.

quotes.Text: I have a personal philosophy in life: If somebody else can do something that I'm doing, they should do it. And what I want to do is find things that would represent a unique contribution to the world - the contribution that only I, and my portfolio of talents, can make happen. Those are my priorities in life.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.Text: What I'm trying to say is that for the average investor, what I would encourage them to do is to understand that there's inflation and growth. It can go higher and lower and to have four different portfolios essentially that make up your entire portfolio that gets you balanced.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Ray Dalio

quotes.Text: Cap and trade is an important tool in California's climate policy portfolio. It sends a price signal to industries to reduce their carbon pollution while generating billions of dollars in revenue for investments in clean transportation and direct pollution reduction.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Kevin de Leon

quotes.Text: It doesn't help to follow every rise and fall of your portfolio. It's better to tune out the day-to-day shifts, in fact. But getting a handle on the larger picture will make you feel more secure, and that goes a long way in calming your fear.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Jean Chatzky

quotes.Text: The most important asset you need to protect in order to manage the demands of a job or an investment portfolio is your production of energy. And, just like with money, if you do a great job managing your energy, you'll get a great return.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Jim Loehr

quotes.Text: I had a fistfight with every kid on my block. I got about fifteen broken noses to prove it. Part of it was also because I was always drawing, and I always had an artist portfolio with me. But I was a tough kid. I won their respect.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: George Lois

quotes.Text: Some people, no matter how robust their stock portfolios or how healthy their children, are always mentally preparing for doom. They are just born worriers, their brains forever anticipating the dropping of some dreaded other shoe.
quotes.Title: Writer
quotes.Name: Robin Marantz Henig

quotes.Text: One should have a wide variety of assets in one's portfolio. And oil, by the way, is a particularly important asset to have in one's portfolio because we need it, and the economy thrives on it.
quotes.Title: American Economist
quotes.Name: Robert J. Shiller

quotes.Text: In an increasingly competitive technology world, VCs must work more and more closely with portfolio companies to develop superior technology, talent, and operations.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Joe Lonsdale

quotes.Text: Prison reform, peace, and a presidential pardon - just a portion of Kushner's portfolio.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Kayleigh McEnany
